title: Looke from Adam, and behold the Protestants faith and religion evidently proued out of the holy Scriptures against all atheists, papists, loose libertines, and carnall gospellers: and that the faith which they professe, hath continued from the beginning of the world, and so is the true and ancient faith. Herein hast thou also a short summe of the whole Bible, and a plaine manifestation, that all holy men who have pleased God, have beene saved through this Christian faith alone.
author: Bullinger, Heinrich, 1504-1575.
publisher: Printed by Iohn Haviland, for Thomas Pavier, and are to be sold at his shop in Ivie Lane,
notes: A translation of: Bullinger, Heinrich.  Antiquissima fides et vera religio.
Translated by Miles Coverdale, whose name appears on leaf A2.
Previous English editions entitled: The olde fayth.
Identified as STC 5893 on UMI microfilm.
